ratings.comment: Tips to get an A- attend every class and for the papers just use quotes from the readers and rewrite what she said in class. I spent one total hour on every paper, put in zero effort and got an A on everything. Same with the exams. Warning:  you will receive a bad grade if you do not attend lecture. Just use what she says and you're golden.

Class was sooo boring, however, if you are looking for an easy literature course, take this. Exams super straight forward and papers were easy. Galina is also such an easy grader. I never read the reader unless to quote for papers (she talks about them in detail in class). If you want to get in A just attend lecture and no other effort is needed.

Lectures can be dry and nothing is online, but it is still a decent class.  Galina is from Russia and is very humorous about Russian culture.  There are 4 papers and quizzes, but they are fairly easy and as long as you pay attention in class, you'll do fine.  Class is pretty mandatory, and readings are from the course reader.

OK.... So here's my review... I had taken Lit 234 prior to 233 and I received a good grade. I came into 233 expecting the same result. I put in the same effort and I flat out received bad grades for no apparent reason. The quiz short answers were either all write or all wrong. Same with the Essays. I either received an A or an F. So idk what to say

I think Dr. Lapina is a very nice lady, however, she doesn't really understand that we as students don't have the knowledge about Russia that she does. She expects you to know every detail about the history of Russia the moment she's lectured it. I think she needs to realize that we have not been senior lecturers of this material for 20+ years.

Galina is a great teacher and knows her stuff about Soviet literature.  She was born in the Soviet Union and is an authentic source.  She does not run a website though and it can be hard to contact her.  If you do your readings you will do just fine in the class.  One thing I seemed to notice with her on papers was to always agree with her.

She's a mixed bag. I took LT233 and her grading was very lenient, with easy topics and rubrics for the tests that let you basically prep everything.. 234 was similar, but the essay grades were WAY harsher for no reason I could tell. She has very precise ideas of what you should be writing about; basically you need to retell her lectures in detail.

Wonderful, friendly lady and enjoyable class. But when the testspapers began, she had expectations that were unknown to everyone. She does not have grading rubrics and does not go into any detail on what she expects from you. I made an extensive effort to get good grades, but she deducted major points for hardly noticeable mistakes.

Interesting class that gives you a pretty good idea of Russian history up till the 20th century. Read if you have time. If not look at summaries at least. She usually gives questions to quiz beforehand and tests are just essays to see if you read. Not very time consuming. Not very hard. She's pretty lenient on grading of essays.

Galina was great. Extremely friendly, willing to help you any day of the week in whatever way she can. Interesting class, especially seeing that she herself grew up in Soviet Russia. Galina is a very friendly grader. You write a few papers on Russian lit novels, take a couple blue book exams, but overall easy class for a non russian or lit major.

So great.  I loved her lectures and it wasn't a ridiculously hard course.  She's really funny and understanding.  The exams were take-home for the large essay portions and the rest was in-class blue book essays.  Manageable.
Great teacher, very helpful. Gives study guides and will meet with you outside of class to clarify material. Made Russian literature interesting, not an easy task.
LOVE HER! SHe's a great professor, easy class, you get study guides for all of the midterms and the essays are take-home.  Interesting class! Def take it!

Love her.  Very interesting lectures, enjoyable reading assignments.  There are three take home exams, and three in class quizzes (she provides a study sheet in advance)--come to class, do the work and you will do well, she is very fair.

She's a fun teacher, very passionate about her subject, which adds a lot.  Her Russian accent also adds a dimension of authenticity.  She's not an easy grader, but not difficult - do the reading, go to class, and take the papers and exams seriously, and you'll get an A, no problem.  A great class, and a great teacher.

She is extremely knowledgable and passionate about the subject.  Sometimes she is hard to understand, but it didn't interfere with my learning.  It won't be a cake walk, but I wouldn't say it's difficult.  I never read the textbook and did little work outside class (maybe one hour per week) and recieved an AB.
The sweetest woman you will ever meet! Her lectures were interesting and funny. She is like the kind lady next door.
